To check for carbohydrate malabsorption, which can occur with certain infections or dietary changes.
To assess for electrolyte imbalances due to diarrhoea and vomiting, which can lead to dehydration and other complications.
To evaluate for signs of infection or inflammation, such as elevated white blood cell count.
To assess kidney function and the degree of dehydration.
To evaluate hydration status and rule out urinary tract infection as a contributing factor.
To assess for inflammation or infection.
